title.narrative: 3.3 WASH:OUTCOME 3 - CHILD SURVIVAL AND DEVELOP.

description.narrative: By 2016, identified beneficiaries benefit equitably from increased access to sustainable and hygienic sanitation, which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, increased quality and effective management of a comprehensive national health system, including health promotion and health protection, with a focus on ensuring more equitable access for the most vulnerable and disadvantaged.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, identified beneficiaries benefit equitably from increased access to sustainable and hygienic sanitation

description.narrative: With UNICEF Viet Nam's technical and financial support the Government operationalized policies, action plans and guidelines to implement and scale up sanitation by using community approaches to total sanitation and sanitation marketing and improve the management of rural water supply schemes. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: Number of approved equity focussed provincial budgets and operational plans for sanitation/ hygiene promotion that are in line with national guidelines.

target.value: 2016:Approval of equity focussed provincial budgets and operational plans in line with national guidelines in 4 out of 7 provinces (2016)

actual.value: 2014:An Giang and Dien Bien provinces have allocated budget in addition to UNICEF-MOH resources for scaling up sanitation programming in favour of poorest and ethnic minority communities.

title.narrative: Availability and dissemination of approved new national guidelines on sanitation marketing and hygiene promotion by MOH

target.value: 2016:New national guidelines on sanitation marketing and hygiene promotion approved by MOH and disseminated

actual.value: 2014:Available:Guidelines on community led total sanitation /sanitation marketing implemented by sector partners. Open Defecation Free (ODF) verification guidelines, implemented in UNICEF focus provinces.

title.narrative: Availability of behaviour change strategies and action plans on hand washing, social marketing and partnership approaches that enable the participation of communities in planning, implementing and monitoring sanitation services in rural settings
Availability of the approved disaster risk reduction and climate change framework and action plans for country-wide response

Availability of water quality management policy frameworks disseminated and fully operational for implementation targeting vulnerable and ethnic minority children and their caregivers living in rural settings
